result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Justin Carl Raff

Defendant Justin Carl Raff in court.  Prosecuting attorney Mark David Bensen in court for the State of Wisconsin. Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found. Court informs Defendant of DNA expungement rights. Def req court appointed counsel. Court appoints Atty Bill Mayer.  Defendant shall reimburse Washington County at a rate of $200 per month commencing 9/15/22. Adjourned to allow defendant to appear with an attorney.  Court sets $5000 signature  bond. Preliminary hearing time limits waived. Court accepts. Adjourned to allow defendant to appear with an attorney and for position on preliminary hearing. 
Hearing scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
Initial appearance on August 31, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
